The Bea
NARSANNAPET2) You are my daughter and you are my beloved in every way. Since you are dependent on me, I have decided to give you some real estate with the intention of providing you with some stability so that you do not face any difficulties in your future life. The house described in the third paragraph below, which was acquired by my ancestors and which has never been subject to any other kind of encroachment, is a house of my complete right and ownership. I, in consideration of the love and affection I have for you, consider the property worth Rs. 8,77,000/- (in words, eight lakhs and seventy seven thousand rupees) as a reward, and I hereby transfer all rights and interests I have over this property to you, free of charge, in the presence of the undersigned witnesses, by means of this registered settlement deed, and hereby transfer it to you immediately. From now on, you will have full rights over the Scheduled Property and you will enjoy it in perpetuity with all the rights of your children, grandchildren, descendants, and descendants. I will never make any claim against you or your heirs or my heirs regarding this. This property is not an assigned property as per the AP9/77 Act. It is not government land. It is not a property belonging to the Waks Board or Endowment Departments. I hereby declare that it has not been included in the Agency property. I am fully responsible for the payment of the depreciation tax if such factual details are confirmed in this document. This property is an undisputed property. This is my full consent and settlement document. Given
Atu teorolaksheeSheet Endorsement

sections.content:
The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 219 of 2026, dated 30/Jan/2026, executed by Attili Varalakshmi in favour of her Daughter,  Balaga Suguna, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 73.33 Sq. Yds. (or)  659.97 Sq. Ft., bearing house number 3-15 and Assessment Number 7-50, comprised in survey number 83-2, situated in Jammu Village and Grama Panchayath, Narasannapeta Mandal, within the District of Srikakulam registered at sub-registrar office Narasannapet is bounded as follows:

North by: Vacant Site of Attili Varalakshmi
South by: Path Way
East by: Foundation of Tarra Sravani
West by: Gravel road.

As per Registered Documents: 1. The property in survey number 83-2, bearing house no. 3-15 and Assessment No. 7-50, situated in Jammu measuring about 73.33 Sq. Yds. (or) 659.97 Sq. Ft., was originally owned by Attili Varalakshmi, who acquired the property from the father’s lineage. [Ref: Deed] 2. The aforementioned Attili Vara Lakshmi executed a Gift Settlement Deed on 30/Jan/2026 registered as document No. 219 of 2026 before the SRO Narasannapet in favour of her Daughter, Balaga Suguna towards the property measuring 73.33 Sq. Yds. (or) 659.97 Sq. Ft., bearing house no. 3-15 and Assessment Number 7-50, comprised in survey no. 83-2, Situated at Jammu. Note: It is observed that there is a mismatch with the house number between the deed (3-15) and E.C (7-50), i it is, therefore advisable for F.I. to obtain updated EC as per Deed, Further noted that the extent of the property is handwritten in the Market Value Statement of the Deed and hence the same may be verified by obtaining a Certified Copy from the concerned SRO, before proceeding to the loan process. (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title : 1. The Property Tax Receipt No. 55, dated 02/Jun/2025, imprinted by the Jammu Grama Panchayath Secretary discloses that Balaga Suguna has paid property tax for the period 2025-2026 towards Assessment number 7-50. 2. The Certificate issued by the Jammu Panchayath Secretary dated 16/Jan/2026 discloses that the property bearing house no. 50, admeasuring 73.33 Sq. Yds , comprised in survey no 83-2, situated at Jammu is vested in the name of Vara Lakshmi as per their record. Note: It is observed that there is a mismatch with the house number between the deed (3-15) and attached Certificate (50), it is, therefore advisable for F.I. to verify the same and proceed accordingly.
The mutation proceedings were concluded in the name of the current owner Balaga Suguna..

sections.content: We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I policy and have concluded that the Balaga Suguna, possesses a clear, valid, and marketable title to the property admeasuring an extent of 73.33 Sq. Yds. (or)  659.97 Sq. Ft., bearing house number 3-15 and Assessment Number 7-50, comprised in survey number 83-2, situated in Jammu Village and Grama Panchayath, Narasannapeta Mandal, within the District of Srikakulam registered at sub-registrar office Narasannapet.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
